title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 56.4 - Transmittal of information to test subjects
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 56.4 - Transmittal of information to test subjects

State Regulations
(a) Each request by a test subject, pursuant
to section
342
(2)
of the Education Law, shall be in writing
and signed by the test subject. Such material shall be transmitted to the test
subject within 30 days after receipt of each such request by the test sponsor
or the sponsor's designated agent, or within 15 days after such sponsor or such
agent has filed with the commissioner the test data in accordance with section
342
(1)
of the Education Law, whichever shall
occur later. (b) Each test
subject's answer sheet shall be considered to include any documents or
materials which are prepared or produced by the test subject during the test
administration and which are evaluated by the test sponsor or the sponsor's
designated agent for purposes of determining the subject's score or performance
on the test. (c) The test sponsor
or the sponsor's designated agent may provide the test subject with a photocopy
of the test subject's answer sheet. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
56.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
